thread.title: Don’t believe Leni, Pagcor tells gaming investors
thread.title_full: Don’t believe Leni, Pagcor tells gaming investors

title: Don’t believe Leni, Pagcor tells gaming investors
text:
Don’t believe Leni, Pagcor tells gaming investors By Paolo Romero (The Philippine Star)   12:00am 
MANILA, Philippines - More brickbats from the administration have come Vice President Leni Robredo’s way with Philippine Amusement and Gaming Corp. (Pagcor) chair Andrea Domingo telling a gathering of investors yesterday not to believe a negative report relayed by the country’s second highest official to a UN body. 
Addressing delegates to the Association of Southeast Asian Nations gaming summit at the Conrad Hotel in Pasay City, Domingo warned that Robredo would do “anything” to become president. 
Domingo was referring to Robredo’s relaying a videotaped message last week to the annual meeting of the UN Commission on Narcotic Drugs in Geneva, criticizing extrajudicial killings and human rights violations in the course of the Duterte administration’s war on drugs. 
The Pagcor chief asked the delegates to ignore Robredo’s tirades unless they start seeing for themselves dead bodies in the streets or people getting killed.
